onshore.translation[0].definitions[0].de: on the land, not in the sea
onshore.translation[0].definitions[1].de: onshore winds are moving from the sea towards the land
onshore.translation[1].definitions[0].de: involving an activity performed in a particular country, rather than outside it
onshore.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The Thai baht reached new lows in onshore trading in Bangkok.
onshore.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a bank etc that is based in a country where taxes are at normal levels, laws are strict etc
onshore.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The bank now wants to expand in onshore business centres such as London, New York and Tokyo.
onshore.translation[1].definitions[2].de: connected with oil and gas production that is done on land
onshore.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: There was only one onshore discovery last year out of seven exploration wells drilled.
